intro: Psychotria glaucescens, commonly known as the blue Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It produces small, black, egg-shaped berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria glaucescens is also noted for its potential psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids.
